abstracts.cdata!:
The projects would provide power to the
            South-Central region of the country (including the heavily
            populated cities of Sao Paulo, Rio de Janeiro, and Belo
            Horizonte), which is the industrial heart of Brazil. A
            consortium of consultants known as CANAMBRA, working under a
            United Nations Special Fund grant for which the Bank acts as
            Executing Agency, have studied the market for power in the
            region. These consultants have also prepared an emergency
            program of expansion, with which the Government is in
            accord, to meet power requirements through 1970. The
            Estreito and Xavantes developments, which together will
            provide additional generating capacity of almost 1 million
            kilowatts, are of high priority within this program. The
            Xavantes project has been under construction for several years.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Estreito Hydroelectric Project will
            provide power to the South-Central region of the country
            (including the heavily populated cities of Sao Paulo, Rio de
            Janeiro, and Belo Horizonte), which is the industrial heart
            of Brazil. A consortium of consultants known as CANAMBRA,
            working under a United Nations Special Fund grant for which
            the Bank acts as Executing Agency, have studied the market
            for power in the region. These consultants have also
            prepared an emergency program of expansion, with which the
            Government is in accord, to meet power requirements through
            1970. The Estreito and Xavantes developments, which together
            will provide additional generating capacity of almost 1
            million kilowatts, are of high priority within this program.
            The Xavantes project has been under construction for several
            years. The projects would provide power to the South-Central
            region of the country (including the heavily populated
            cities of Sao Paulo, Rio de Janeiro, and Belo Horizonte),
            which is the industrial heart of Brazil. A consortium of
            consultants known as CANAMBRA, working under a United
            Nations Special Fund grant for which the Bank acts as
            Executing Agency, have studied the market for power in the
            region. These consultants have also prepared an emergency
            program of expansion, with which the Government is in
            accord, to meet power requirements through 1970. The
            Estreito and Xavantes developments, which together will
            provide additional generating capacity of almost 1 million
            kilowatts, are of high priority within this program. The
            Xavantes project has been under construction for several years.
